original_text:
Buffalo Toro
In principio è stato Wild Toro, con ben due capitoli, poi ci sono stati Book of Toro e Toro 7’s. Adesso la Elk ritorna con Buffalo Toro, una slot epica che non deluderà gli appassionati della serie.
Come nelle precedenti occasioni, anche in questo caso lo stile grafico riprende quello dei cartoon. Ambientato nel Nevada, il gioco si apre con l’animazione del toro che sorvola la cartina del mondo inseguito dal matador. I simboli sono ispirati dalla fauna tipica di questo spazio desertico: orsi, lupi e bufali, solo per citarne alcuni.
La musica che accompagna gli Spin è incalzante, con sonorità che ricordano i vecchi film western.
Cosa aspettarsi da Buffalo Toro
La slot presenta una griglia con 6 rulli e 4 righe e ben 4.096 modi per vincere. La puntata minima è di 0,20 €, ma volendo si può portare a un massimo di 50 €. L’Autoplay consente di mandare gli Spins in modalità automatica, ottima funzione per chi non ha voglia di cliccare per ogni giocata.
Il valore RTP non è altissimo, si attesta al 94%, ma ricordiamo che questo è un valore teorico calcolato su migliaia di partite. La volatilità è alta.
Walking Wild e tanti Bonus
In Buffalo Toro troviamo simboli di basso valore e altri più remunerativi. Al primo gruppo appartengono le carte da gioco dal nove all’asso, mentre nel secondo gruppo ci sono l’orso, il lupo, la lince, l’aquila e il bufalo.
Abbiamo tre simboli Wild: quello classico sostituisce tutti i simboli regolari, ma non quelli speciali. Un secondo Jolly è la cartolina del tramonto che svolge le stesse funzioni del Wild classico, ma in più moltiplica x2 o x3 la vincita. C’è poi il Walking Wild rappresentato dal Toro con un copricapo pellerossa. La sua particolarità e di generare Respins muovendosi verso sinistra a ogni giocata.
Il Matador invece regala un Respin e rimane bloccato sui rulli. Se contemporaneamente appare un Toro sui rulli, allora si dà avvio alla funzione Toro Goes Wild. In pratica il Toro si muove verso il Matador lasciandosi dietro una scia di Wild. Il gioco termina quando l’ultimo toro esce dal rullo di sinistra.
La moneta d’oro con il bisonte è il nostro Scatter e regala da 8 a 20 Free Spins. Nella parte superiore compare un contatore con l’icona dei simboli che viene riempito grazie ai bisonti d’oro. Se ad esempio il contatore «orso» viene completato, allora il simbolo corrispondente scompare e al suo posto appariranno bisonti.
Con il simbolo Super Bonus invece si attiva la funzione Rampage Reels per cui vedremo atterrare sui rulli soltanto simboli bisonti d’oro.

FAQ: Le risposte alle domande più frequenti 
Quanto è la vincita massima in Buffalo Toro?

La vincita massima è di 50.000 volte la puntata.



Quanti Wild ci sono in Buffalo Toro?

Troviamo 3 Wild: classico, moltiplicatore, Walking Wild



Posso giocare a Buffalo Toro sullo smartphone?

Certo, si può giocare a Buffalo Toro anche su pc o tablet, senza perdere in fluidità.

raw_translation.response:
Buffalo Toro Review: A Wild West Adventure

Elk Studios has done it again with the release of their latest slot game, Buffalo Toro. Set in the Nevada desert, this epic slot is sure to excite fans of the series with its stunning cartoon graphics and Western-themed soundtrack.

With a grid of 6 reels and 4 rows, and a whopping 4,096 ways to win, Buffalo Toro offers a minimum bet of 0.20 € and a maximum of 50€. The Autoplay feature allows players to set spins to run automatically, perfect for those who want to sit back and enjoy the action.

The game features low-value card symbols, as well as high-paying symbols inspired by the wildlife of the desert, including bears, wolves, and, of course, buffaloes. The Walking Wild symbol, represented by a bull with a headdress, generates respins as it moves left with each spin. The classic Wild symbol substitutes for all regular symbols, while the sunset postcard has the same function, but multiplies wins by 2 or 3.

The Matador symbol grants a respin and stays locked in place on the reels. If a bull appears at the same time, the Toro Goes Wild feature is triggered, allowing the bull to move towards the Matador, leaving a trail of Wilds behind. The game ends when the last bull leaves the leftmost reel.

The Golden Bison coin is the Scatter symbol, offering 8 to 20 free spins and filling a counter with corresponding symbols that disappear when completed to be replaced by more golden bisons. The Super Bonus symbol activates the Rampage Reels feature, causing only gold bison symbols to land on the reels.

With a theoretical RTP of 94% and high volatility, Buffalo Toro is a wild ride for experienced gamblers and offers a maximum win of 50,000 times the bet. Play on desktop or mobile for an even smoother experience.

raw_translation.response:
Buffalo Toro

Initially there was Wild Toro, with two chapters, then there were Book of Toro and Toro 7's. Now Elk returns with Buffalo Toro, an epic slot machine that will not disappoint fans of the series.

As on previous occasions, the graphic style follows that of cartoons. Set in Nevada, the game opens with an animation of the bull flying over the world map chased by the matador. The symbols are inspired by the typical fauna of this desert area: bears, wolves and buffaloes, to name a few.

The music accompanying the spins is relentless, with sounds reminiscent of old western films.

What to expect from Buffalo Toro

The slot features a grid with 6 reels and 4 rows and an impressive 4,096 ways to win. The minimum bet is €0.20, but it can be increased up to a maximum of €50. The Autoplay feature allows for automatic spins, a great function for those who don't want to click for every game.

The RTP value is not very high, at 94%, but it's worth remembering that this is a theoretical value calculated over thousands of games. The volatility is high.

Walking Wild and many bonuses

In Buffalo Toro, we find low-value symbols and others that are more lucrative. The first group includes playing cards from nine to ace, while the second group includes the bear, wolf, lynx, eagle, and buffalo.

There are three Wild symbols: the classic one replaces all regular symbols, but not special ones. A second wild is the postcard of the sunset, which has the same functions as the classic Wild, but also multiplies the win by x2 or x3. Then there is the Walking Wild represented by the Bull with a Native American headdress. Its peculiarity is to generate Respins by moving to the left with every play.

The Matador, on the other hand, gives a Respin and stays locked on the reels. If a Bull appears on the reels at the same time, then the Toro Goes Wild function is triggered. In practice, the Bull moves towards the Matador, leaving behind a trail of Wild symbols. The game ends when the last Bull leaves the left reel.

The gold coin with the bison is our Scatter and gives 8 to 20 Free Spins. In the upper part, there is a counter with the icon of the symbols that is filled thanks to the golden bisons. For example, if the "bear" counter is completed, the corresponding symbol disappears and bisons appear in its place.

With the Super Bonus symbol, the Rampage Reels function is activated, and we will see only golden bison symbols landing on the reels.

FAQ: Answers to the most frequently asked questions

What is the maximum win in Buffalo Toro?

The maximum win is 50,000 times the bet.

How many Wilds are there in Buffalo Toro?

There are 3 Wilds: classic, multiplier, Walking Wild.

Can I play Buffalo Toro on my smartphone?

Certainly, you can play Buffalo Toro on a PC or tablet, without losing in fluidity.

Review:
 
Gameplay features

Buffalo Toro is a 6-reel, 4-row slot game with up to 4,096 ways to win. Players can set their bets from a minimum of €0.20 up to a maximum of €50 per spin. The game features three Wild symbols, with one of them being a Walking Wild that generates respins by moving to the left with every play. Additionally, there is a Matador symbol that gives a Respin and stays locked on the reels when it appears.

Symbols and graphics

Buffalo Toro's symbols draw inspiration from the typical fauna of the desert area of Nevada, featuring creatures like bears, wolves, lynxes, eagles, and buffaloes. The graphic style of the game is cartoonish, with vivid colors and well-defined animations. Scatter symbols of a gold coin with a bison on it awards players with up to 20 free spins and a feature called Rampage Reels where only golden bison symbols land on the reels.

Betting range

The minimum bet in Buffalo Toro is €0.20, and players can increase their wagers up to a maximum of €50 per spin. The game includes the Autoplay feature that allows players to set a number of automatic spins, making it easier for those who prefer not to have to click for every game.

Compatibility

Buffalo Toro can be played on a PC, tablet, and smartphone, maintaining the same level of quality and fluidity across platforms.

RTP and Volatility

Buffalo Toro's RTP is 94%, which is average for slots. Its volatility is high, meaning that while players can expect relatively large payouts, they might need to be patient until they hit a winning combination. The maximum win is 50,000 times the bet, which can be a tempting payout for some players.

Review: Buffalo Toro

Initially there was Wild Toro, with two chapters, then there were Book of Toro and Toro 7's. Now Elk returns with Buffalo Toro, an epic slot machine that will not disappoint fans of the series.

As on previous occasions, the graphic style follows that of cartoons. Set in Nevada, the game opens with an animation of the bull flying over the world map chased by the matador. The symbols are inspired by the typical fauna of this desert area: bears, wolves and buffaloes, to name a few.

The music accompanying the spins is relentless, with sounds reminiscent of old western films.

What to expect from Buffalo Toro

The slot features a grid with 6 reels and 4 rows and an impressive 4,096 ways to win. The minimum bet is €0.20, but it can be increased up to a maximum of €50. The Autoplay feature allows for automatic spins, a great function for those who don't want to click for every game.

The RTP value is not very high, at 94%, but it's worth remembering that this is a theoretical value calculated over thousands of games. The volatility is high.

Walking Wild and many bonuses

In Buffalo Toro, we find low-value symbols and others that are more lucrative. The first group includes playing cards from nine to ace, while the second group includes the bear, wolf, lynx, eagle, and buffalo.

There are three Wild symbols: the classic one replaces all regular symbols, but not special ones. A second wild is the postcard of the sunset, which has the same functions as the classic Wild, but also multiplies the win by x2 or x3. Then there is the Walking Wild represented by the Bull with a Native American headdress. Its peculiarity is to generate Respins by moving to the left with every play.

The Matador, on the other hand, gives a Respin and stays locked on the reels. If a Bull appears on the reels at the same time, then the Toro Goes Wild function is triggered. In practice, the Bull moves towards the Matador, leaving behind a trail of Wild symbols. The game ends when the last Bull leaves the left reel.

The gold coin with the bison is our Scatter and gives 8 to 20 Free Spins. In the upper part, there is a counter with the icon of the symbols that is filled thanks to the golden bisons. For example, if the "bear" counter is completed, the corresponding symbol disappears and bisons appear in its place.

With the Super Bonus symbol, the Rampage Reels function is activated, and we will see only golden bison symbols landing on the reels.

FAQ: Answers to the most frequently asked questions

What is the maximum win in Buffalo Toro?

The maximum win is 50,000 times the bet.

How many Wilds are there in Buffalo Toro?

There are 3 Wilds: classic, multiplier, Walking Wild.

Can I play Buffalo Toro on my smartphone?

Certainly, you can play Buffalo Toro on a PC or tablet, without losing in fluidity.
